intro: Chrysoglossum gibbsiae, commonly known as the Gibbs' chrysoglossum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped yellow flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists.
